class.name: Edgelord

default: (a) a {@item rapier|phb}, (b) a {@item longsword|phb}, or (c) {@filter any simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) an {@item explorer's pack|phb} or (b) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb}

classFeatures: The One Who Brings the Darkness|Edgelord|TheEdgelord|7
Life is the Only True Curse|Edgelord|TheEdgelord|15

classFeature.name: Ow the Edge
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you learn to release a physical manifestation of your pain and suffering. As an action you can strike a pose and spit a quick nihilistic one-liner: All creatures in 10ft. must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d4 + your Charisma Modifier slashing magical damage. The dice you roll changes as reported on the Edge Dice column.

You gain additional bonuses to this feature at the 5th, 11th and 18th level. Some of your edgelord features require your target ot make a saving throw to resist the feature's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
{@homebrew This feature's addiitonal abilities are spread into different features for ease of reading and staying consistent to the class table by the converter.}

classFeature.name: Affinity to Darkness
entries: As an edgelord darkness is your natural environment, you feel safe and at home in the deepest darkness. At 2nd level, you can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet and add your Charisma modifier to all of your {@skill Stealth} checks while in darkness or in dim light.

classFeature.name: Edgy Stereotype
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you commit yourself to an edgy stereotype, such as the Dark Soul, the Emo, or the Mary Sue. Your stereotype grants you features at 3rd level and again at 9th, 13th and 17th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ow the Edge Improvement
entries: When you reach 5th level, your Ow the Edge feature improves as follows:
At 5th level you add your hate to your pain: if a creature fails the saving throw by 10 or more it becomes {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d4} minutes.

classFeature.name: Shadow Ambush
entries: At 6th level you learn how to travel instantly between shadows. When you are in dim light or darkness, as a bonus action you can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness. All creatures in 10 ft. have disadvantage on saving throws until the end of turn.

classFeature.name: The One Who Brings the Darkness
entries: At 7th level you learn how to manipulate the darkness that you love so much. As an action you can make some of the darkness of your soul leak out from your body creating a 10ft. area of dim light centered on yourself. The effect ends after one minute.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Edgy Stereotype Feature
entries: At 9th level, you gain a feature granted by your Edgy Stereotype.

classFeature.name: One with Darkness
entries: At 10th level you learn how to temporarily transform your body into darkness. When you are in dim light or darkness, when a creature makes a melee attack against you, you can use your reaction to make your body evanescent and ghost-like, until your next turn you gain 5 AC. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier per long rest (min 1).

classFeature.name: Ow the Edge Improvement
entries: When you reach 11th level, your Ow the Edge feature improves as follows:

At 11th level your inner suffering is so brutal that no one and nothing is truly safe from it: whenever you use this feature its damage ignores all resistances and immunities to magical slashing damage.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Edgy Stereotype Feature
entries: At 13th level, you gain a feature granted by your Edgy Stereotype.

classFeature.name: Edgy Aura
entries: At 14th level you learn how to share your inner pain with others so that they'll understand a little bit of what you experience every day. A sphere of 5 ft. centered on oyu is now filled with your crystallized suffering. Another creature that enters the sphere or starts its turn inside it takes {@dice 1d8} + Charisma modifier magical slashing damage.

classFeature.name: Life is the Only True Curse
entries: At 15th level you realize that some things are not strong enough to hurt you, especially curses. Your life is already a curse so your body has become resistant to them. As an action you can cast the spell {@spell remove curse} on yourself or an object you're attuned with.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Edgy Stereotype Feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature granted by your Edgy Stereotype.

classFeature.name: Ow the Edge Improvement
entries: When you reach 18th level, your Ow the Edge feature improves as follows:

At 18th level your words alone are enough to fill the air with unbearable pain and sorrow. Even the creature that tries to run away for you are able to escape it. When you use this feature all the creatures that are able to hear you have to make the saving throw.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Thorns of Pain
entries: At 20th level your soul itself will try its hardest to keep you alive, death would be an easy way out of your damned life. Once per long rest, when your hit points reach 0 and you fall {@condition unconscious} a cluster of thorny plants with black flowers appears from your chest and expands all around. All other creatures in 100 ft must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes {@dice 8d6} necrotic damage. At the end of the turn the plants disappear and you regain hit points equal to the damage dealt.

subclassFeature.name: Mary Sue Stereotype
entries: Mary Sues (or Gary Stus) discovered a little upside in their eternal damnation: being more unique and better than anyone else. Other people are all the same: boring and conformist.

subclassFeature.name: Expertise
entries: At 3rd level, choose two of your skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

subclassFeature.name: Feelings in Magic
entries: At 3rd level you discover that your emotions, caused by years of suffering, are so pure and strong that they give you the ability to use magic. Choose 3 cantrips from any class' spell list, you can cast them using Charisma as your spellcasting ability. You can choose different cantrips after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: So Quirky
entries: At 9th level, you learned how to channel your feelings to distance yourself from the masses creating new unique powers. You gain the effects of a warlock's invocation of your choice (you can't choose an invocation with pact-specific requirements). You can choose a different invocation after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Destiny's Kindness
entries: At 13th level you understand that destiny itself wants to repay you for a life of inner suffering, so it gives you the ability to channel your feelings in powerful spells. Choose a level 4 or lower spell from any class' spell list, you can cast that spell once per short rest (the spell is considered to be cast using a 4th level spell slot). You can choose a different spell after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Spellcasting
entries: At 17th level you mastered more spells than lots of powerful wizards, so you're ready to cast even more spells. Choose a spell from any class' spell list, you can cast that spell once per short rest (the spell is considered to be cast using a 9th level spell slot). You can choose a different spell after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Soul Stereotype
entries: Years of suffering and pain can easily corrupt an innocent soul. Some edgelords learned to live in symbiosis with the evil that lives within their soul, giving it physical form willing to help them in their struggles. The only thing it asks in return is being able to feed from their damned soul.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Evilness
entries: Starting from 3rd level your soul emanates a constant aura of evilness. All evil-aligned creatures are friendly to you and won't attack you until you try to harm them first.

subclassFeature.name: The Evil Inside
entries: At 3rd level you learn how to summon the incarnation of your corrupted soul. As a bonus action you can summon a {@creature Shadow|mm} (the DM has its stats), the Shadow is friendly to you and your allies and it shares your initiative. The Shadow can move in any direction up to 30ft. from you, if you're more than 30ft. away the Shadow will disappear. You can use your bonus action to give the Shadow orders thanks to a telepathic link. The Shadow can use your Ow the Edge feature (use your Charisma modifier). You take all the damage the Shadow would take.

subclassFeature.name: Perpetual Darkness
entries: At 9th level, the Shadow creates an aura of 5ft. radius of darkness to compensate its sunlight sensitivity. All ranged attacks against the Shadow have disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Stronger Bonds
entries: At 13th level, the connection between you and the Shadow grows stronger, now your Shadow obtain your spiritual strength. Every time the Shadow rolls a dice you can add your Charisma modifier (min. 1) to the result.

subclassFeature.name: Puppet of Evil
entries: At 17th level your Shadow wants more than just feeding from your soul, it wants the living energy of your enemies. As an action you can command your shadow to control a creature of your choice in 30ft. from you. You can use your bonus action to give the controlled creature orders thanks to a telepathic link. At the start of their turn the controlled creature has to make a Charisma saving throw, on a failed save it takes {@dice 8d8} psychic damage and is considered {@condition paralyzed} for the turn, the posession ends if it passes the save. The Shadow can only control one creature for long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Emo Stereotype
entries: Sometimes inner pain can seem unbearable, so some edgelords decided to control it through physical pain to keep their mind strong. This fight between external and inner pain caused their blood to be soaked with magical power. they think blood is the only thing strong enough to purify their suffering soul.

subclassFeature.name: Purifying Blood
entries: At 3rd level your blood is more powerful than the one of any normal creature being able to protect you from any kind of disease.

subclassFeature.name: Bloody Edge
entries: At 3rd level you can use your pain to increase the power of your suffering's manifestation. When you use your Ow the Edge feature you can decide to add a number of dice up to your Charisma modifier (min. 1) of the same type to the damage. Before rolling for the damage roll the dices you added, you lose hit points equal to the result.

subclassFeature.name: Pain Tolerance
entries: At 9th level your pain tolerance has become much higher than normal creatures, whenever you take damage you can use your reaction to gain temporary hit points equal to that damage. you can only use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bloody Visions
entries: At 13th level your blood is so filled with magical power that can transcend time itself; you can use your own blood to make a divination ritual. When you finish a long rest, roll one d20: you suffer necrotic damage equal to the result and record the number rolled. You can repeat this process as many time as you want but you can only record one result. Once per long rest you can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can se with the recorded roll. You must choose to do so before the roll. After a long rest you lose the recorded roll.

subclassFeature.name: Suffering Incarnated
entries: At 17th level your blood is saturated with your pain and suffering, this combined with its magical properties gave it primitive form of mind of its own, it will do its best trying to protect you. Once per long rest, when you take damage, you can use your reaction to summon a Blood Elemental out of your open wounds (it has the same stats of the {@creature water elemental|mm}, the DM has its stats). The elemental is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the elemental, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the elemental, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions. The Blood Elemental disappears after one minute.

entries.name: The Edgelord
entries: A drow dressed in black is completely surrounded by enemies much bigger than him, he smiles, he hides his face with his hand, after a quick one-liner his attackers fall to the ground dead covered in bloody cuts.

A group of goblins run away at breakneck speed in a dark cave, around the corner they stop to take a breath, thinking they are safe but their pursuer is already there waiting for them. His aura is overwhelming and his mere presence opens new wounds on the bodies of poor goblins.

A powerful lich imposes its most dangerous curse ont the dwarf who has dared to confront it but is shocked when it is immediately broken. The dwarf replies promptly:"Your curse is nothing compared to my eternal torments...".
A human girl is sitting at the counter of the inn explaining to the first man who sat next to her how she is not like the other girls, in fact, she is a self-diagnosed bipolar sociopath.

entries.name: Eternal Suffering
entries: You can't choose to become an edgelord, it's like a curse placed on a still innocent infant, a cruel twist of fate that condemns a life. Edgelords' soul is in constant agony, demons and remorse torment it relentlessly causing immense pain. Nobody will ever be able to understand such a tormented person and maybe that's for the best. Therefore they are loners, most of them decide to isolate themselves from everyone to avoid hurting them. But others have learned to channel their pain as a bloody weapon that can bring them closer to their goals.

entries.name: Creating an Edgelord
entries: When creating your edgelord think about what happened of so tragic and brutal in their past  to scar their mind and soul permanently.Maybe it was the death of their parents? Or maybe the brutal understanding of the meaninglessness of life? Or probably they were just born with an awful personality. It's also important to think about how they will interact with the party. It's just dead weight or a useful tool? Does the party fear or admire them?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make an edgelord quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Charisma your highest ability score, followed by either Strength or Dexterity. Second, choose the {@background Criminal} background.
